ext.msg: The extension member, ${Rule.member.label} is used on the axis ${Rule.axis.label} with the element ${fact1.label} with a value of ${fact1.value}.
ext.hint: Extension members should not be used with the ${Rule.axis.label}.

std.msg: The member, ${Rule.member.label} is used on the axis ${Rule.axis.label} with the element ${fact1.label} with a value of ${fact1.value}.
std.hint: This member should not be used with the ${Rule.axis.label}.

nofact.msg: The member, ${Rule.member.label}, is used on the axis, ${Rule.axis.label} in the disclosure group ${group}.
nofact.hint: There are no facts associated with this member and axis. Extension members should not be used with the ${Rule.axis.label}.

DQC.US.0004.msg: ${fact1.label} with a value of ${fact1.value} is not equal to the total of ${fact2.label} with a value of ${fact2.value}.

DQC.US.0005.17.msg: The date of ${fact1.period} used for ${fact1.label} with a value of ${fact1.value} is earlier than the reporting period end date ${dei:DocumentPeriodEndDate.fact.value}.
DQC.US.0005.17.hint: Update the date used for ${fact1.label} to be the same as the cover sheet of the filing.

DQC.US.0005.48.msg: The date of ${fact1.period.endDate} used for ${fact1.label} and the ${us-gaap:SubsequentEventTypeAxis.label} with a value of ${fact1.value} is earlier than or the same as the reporting period end date of ${dei:DocumentPeriodEndDate.fact.value}.
DQC.US.0005.48.hint: Either remove the subsequent event axis from this value, change the end date for the value or update the Document and Entity Information ${dei:DocumentPeriodEndDate.fact.label}.

DQC.US.0005.49.msg: The date of ${fact1.period.endDate} used for ${fact1.label} and the ${us-gaap:StatementScenarioAxis.label} and ${us-gaap:ScenarioForecastMember.label} with a value of ${fact1.value} is earlier than or the same as the reporting period end date of ${dei:DocumentPeriodEndDate.fact.value}.
DQC.US.0005.49.hint: Either remove the statement scenario axis and forecast member from this value, change the end date for the value or update the Document and Entity Information ${dei:DocumentPeriodEndDate.fact.label}.

DQC.US.0006.msg: The number of days, ${fact1.period.durationDays}, in the date range reported for ${fact1.label}, ${fact1.period.startDate} to ${fact1.period.endDate} is not consistent with the ${dei:DocumentFiscalPeriodFocus.fact.label} value of ${dei:DocumentFiscalPeriodFocus.fact.value}.

DQC.US.0008.msg: The calculation in the extension taxonomy shows ${extCalcTarget.label} as a calculation component of ${extCalcSource.label}. This is the opposite of a calculation defined in the base US GAAP taxonomy.
DQC.US.0008.hint: Check that the calculation is correct or that you have used the correct tag for the two elements identified in the calculation.

DQC.US.0009.msg: The value of ${fact1.label}, ${fact1.value}, should be less than or equal to ${fact2.label}, ${fact2.value}.

DQC.US.0009.39.msg: The value of ${fact1.label}, ${fact1.value}, should be less than or equal to ${fact2.label}, ${fact2.value}.

DQC.US.0009.40.msg: The value of ${fact1.label}, ${fact1.fact.value}, should be less than or equal to ${fact2.label}, ${fact2.value}.

DQC.US.0009.41.msg: The value of ${fact1.label}, ${fact1.value}, should be less than or equal to ${fact2.label}, ${fact2.value}.

DQC.US.0009.42.msg: The value of ${fact1.label}, ${fact1.value}, should be less than or equal to ${fact2.label}, ${fact2.value}.

DQC.US.0009.45.msg: The value of ${fact1.label}, ${fact1.value}, should be less than or equal to ${fact2.label}, ${fact2.value}.
DQC.US.0009.45.hint: The value of the remaining contribution for the year should be less than or equal to the expected contributions for the entire year.

DQC.US.0009.46.msg: The value of ${fact1.label}, ${fact1.value}, should be less than or equal to ${fact2.label}, ${fact2.value}.
DQC.US.0009.46.hint: ${fact1.label} must be less than or equal to ${fact2.label}, as it does not include assumptions about future compensation levels.

DQC.US.0011.msg: It is expected that ${fact1.label} with a value of ${fact1.value} should be equal to the dimensionally qualified concept, ${fact2.label} with the dimension ${fact2.dimensions} and a reported value of ${fact2.value} multiplied by ${weight}.
DQC.US.0011.hint: This error occurs when the dimensionally qualified fact is not equal to the value input for the standalone item.

DQC.US.0013.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0013.hint: This element should not have a negative value when the value for the element ${preconditionfact.label} is greater than zero.

DQC.US.0014.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0014.hint: This element should not have a negative value.

DQC.US.0015.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.hint: This element should not have a negative value.

DQC.US.0015.243.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.243.hint: This element represents the excess tax benefit associated with share based compensation, and excludes tax deficiencies that occur when the value of the stock based compensation is less than the compensation expense recognized. If this is a tax deficiency, use the element Adjustments to Additional Paid in Capital, Income Tax Deficiency from Share-based Compensation.

DQC.US.0015.262.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.262.hint: This element represents the amortization of lease incentives offered by the lessor to the lessee, and should only be used by the lessor to reflect the allocated expense associated with the incentive over the life of the lease.

DQC.US.0015.310.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.310.hint: This element represents the total losses on available for sale securities with net losses reported in accumulated other comprehensive income. The value of this element cannot be negative, as that would represent a gain on available for sale securities. If this is a gain, use the element Available-for-sale Securities, Accumulated Gross Unrealized Gain, before Tax.

DQC.US.0015.456.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.456.hint: This element should be a positive amount as it represents the  insurance, maintenance, and taxes to be paid by the lessor that offset the future minimum payments of the lessee.

DQC.US.0015.457.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.457.hint: It represents the difference between the total future minimum lease payments and the discounted present value of those lease payments. It is often shown as a deduction from the total minimum lease payments to calculate the present value of the minimum lease payments.  A negative value would imply a negative interest rate which is unlikely.

DQC.US.0015.476.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.476.hint: If a negative value was reported to represent payments greater than the cash acquired, use the element Payments to Acquire Businesses, Net of Cash Acquired.

DQC.US.0015.493.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.493.hint: In the roll forward of accretable yield, the accretion amount is deducted and is often shown as a negative value. However, the accretion amount that reduces the balance should be reported as a positive amount.

DQC.US.0015.496.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.496.hint: This amount is often shown as a deduction from contractual cash flows to calculate the value of loans accounted for under ASC 310-30. It should be reported as a positive amount.

DQC.US.0015.497.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.497.hint: In the roll forward of accretable yield, the accretion amount is deducted and is often shown as a negative value. However, the accretion amount that reduces the balance should be reported as a positive amount.

DQC.US.0015.629.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.629.hint: If the element is negative because it represents a deferred tax liability, use the element Deferred Tax Liabilities, Deferred Expense.

DQC.US.0015.633.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.633.hint: This element is often shown as a reduction in deferred tax assets. This element should be reported with a positive value when it reduces the value of deferred tax assets.

DQC.US.0015.640.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.640.hint: If a deferred tax asset is being reported for derivatives, use the element Deferred Tax Assets, Derivative Instruments.

DQC.US.0015.951.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.951.hint: This element should not be used to represent a repayment of debt on the cash flow statement. To represent the repayment of debt on the cash flow statement, use an element representing repayments of debt.

DQC.US.0015.1032.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.1032.hint: If it is entered as a negative amount to represent a transfer out of Level 3, use the element Fair Value, Measurement with Unobservable Inputs Reconciliation, Liability, Transfers out of Level 3 to represent the reduction in Level 3 liabilities.

DQC.US.0015.1240.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.1240.hint: If the item represents a gross loss on derivative instruments, use the element Loss on Derivative Instruments, Pretax. If it represents a net loss on derivative instruments, use the element Gain (Loss) on Derivative Instruments, Net, Pretax.

DQC.US.0015.1306.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.1306.hint: If this element is a research tax credit, use the element Effective Income Tax Rate Reconciliation, Tax Credit, Research, Amount. If it is nondeductible research and development expense it should be entered as a positive amount.

DQC.US.0015.1428.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.1428.hint: If this represents a short position, use the Position Axis and Short Member with this element to indicate the notional derivative amount is in a short position, and report the value as a positive amount.

DQC.US.0015.1615.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.1615.hint: This element represents the receipt of collections from related parties which reduces the receivables balance, and not the receipt of cash.

DQC.US.0015.2169.msg: ${fact1.label} has a value of ${fact1.value} which is less than zero.
DQC.US.0015.2169.hint: This element represents the increase in the value of real estate during the period, and not the cash payments made for real estate improvements. This element should not be used for payments for capital improvements.

DQC.US.0018.msg: ${element.label} is a deprecated item, but has been included in the company's presentation tree.
hint: Deprecated items should not be used in the filing. Guidance on the replacement item to use for this item is provided in the Deprecated Label of the ${element.name} concept.

DQC.US.0033.msg: The ending date of ${fact1.period.endDate} used for ${fact1.label} must be the same as the ${dei:DocumentPeriodEndDate.fact.label}, ${dei:DocumentPeriodEndDate.fact.period.endDate}.
DQC.US.0033.hint: Revise either the date of the ${fact1.label} or the date of the ${dei:DocumentPeriodEndDate.fact.label}.

DQC.US.0036.msg: The ending date of ${fact1.period.endDate} used for ${fact1.label} must match the value reported for the element, ${fact1.value}.
DQC.US.0036.hint: Revise either the ending context date or the value of the ${fact1.label}.

DQC.US.0041.msg: The default for the ${axis.name} in the base taxonomy is ${axis_default.name}, but the default has been replaced with ${default.name}.
DQC.US.0041.hint: The dimension default defined for the axis in the US GAAP taxonomy should not be changed in a company extension taxonomy.

debit.msg: The concept ${fact1.label} is included in the calculation of ${NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities.label}. ${fact1.label} is a debit balance type concept representing a natural cash inflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to ${NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations.label}. A debit balance type concept should always be assigned a positive one (+1) calculation weight, as it is an addition to net income (loss) to reconcile to Net Cash Provided By Used In Operating Activities. ${fact1.label} has been incorrectly provided a negative one (-1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy.
debit.hint: Correct the calculation weight to positive one (+1) and input the value as a positive amount.

credit.msg: The concept ${fact1.label} is included in the calculation of ${NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities.label}. ${fact1.label} is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash inflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to ${NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations.label}. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight, as it is a subtraction to net income (loss) to reconcile to Net Cash Provided By Used In Operating Activities. ${fact1.label} has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy.
credit.hint: Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount.

debit.msg: The concept ${fact1.label} is included in the calculation of ${NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities.label}.
content: ${fact1.label} is a debit balance type concept representing a natural cash inflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to ${NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities.label}.

A debit balance type concept should always be assigned a positive one (+1) calculation weight, as it is an addition to net income (loss) to reconcile to Net Cash Provided By Used In Operating Activities.
${fact1.label} has been incorrectly provided a negative one (-1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy.
debit.hint: Correct the calculation weight to positive one (+1) and input the value as a positive amount.

credit.msg: The concept ${fact1.label} is included in the calculation of ${NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities.label}.
content: ${fact1.label} is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash inflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to ${NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities.label}.

A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight, as it is a subtraction to net income (loss) to reconcile to Net Cash Provided By Used In Operating Activities.
${fact1.label} has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy.
credit.hint: Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount.

DQC.US.0044.6834.msg: The concept ${fact1.label} with a value of ${fact1.value} is an accrual-based item in the US GAAP taxonomy that is included in the sum of ${sum.label} in the cash flows of the extension taxonomy. Accrual-based concepts should not be included in the financing section of the cash flows statement of the extension taxonomy.
DQC.US.0044.6834.hint: Replace ${fact1.label} with an appropriate US GAAP taxonomy cash flows item, if available or, if not, consider extending a concept.

DQC.US.0044.7503.msg: The concept ${fact1.label} with a value of ${fact1.value} is an accrual-based item in the US GAAP taxonomy that is included in the sum of ${sum.label} in the cash flows of the extension taxonomy. Accrual-based concepts should not be included in the investing section of the cash flows statement of the extension taxonomy.
DQC.US.0044.7503.hint: Replace ${fact1.label} with an appropriate US GAAP taxonomy cash flows item, if available or, if not, consider extending a concept.

DQC.US.0045.msg: The concept ${Result_item.label} appears as a child of ${item2.label} in the company's extension taxonomy. The concept ${Result_item.name} is expected to be a child of ${item1.name}.
DQC.US.0045.hint: Please review the calculations defined for this item to determine that the correct element has been used.

DQC.US.0046.msg: In the company's extension taxonomy the concept ${parentElement.name} includes ${childElement.name} as a summation-child. The concept ${childElement.name} should not appear as a descendent of ${parentElement.name}.

DQC.US.0047.msg: In the company's extension taxonomy the concept ${parentElement.name} includes ${childElement.name} as a summation-child. The concept ${childElement.name} should not appear as a child of ${parentElement.name} because it does not have a balance type.
DQC.US.0047.hint: Increase (Decrease) items without balance attributes are used in a roll forward and should not be used in the cash flow statement as they represent the impact on the balance sheet item which is the opposite of the impact on cash.

DQC.US.0048.msg: Required calculation root is missing in the cash flow statement calculation linkbase(s) ${networkRole}.
content: The filing should include in the cash flow statement calculation linkbase(s) ${networkRole} one of the following elements as the root(first element) of the calculation tree to represent the aggregate change in cash for the period:
Prior to adoption of ASU-2016-18: CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecrease, CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect.

Subsequent to adoption of ASU-2016-18: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffect, CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect, NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations (As long as the element NetCashProvidedByUsedInDiscontinuedOperations is also included the reconciliation between opening and closing cash).
The calculation linkbase in the filing has the following root elements defined: ${elementNames}.

If you have used an extension element that reflects the changes made for ASU-2016-18 in the 2017 taxonomy then create either of the following extension elements with the following names: CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffect, CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect.

DQC.US.0049.msg: The following elements ${elementNames} are parent (root) elements defined in the calculation relationship for the cash flow statement using the group ${networkRole}.
content: The cash flow statement should only have one calculation parent for durational concepts representing the increase or decrease in cash during the period. The element should be moved to be represented as a calculation child to the movement in cash for the period.

If the company has adopted ASU-2016-18 then the root element used to represent the aggregate change in cash should be the element CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffect. If the company specifically excludes the exchange rate effect from the total then the element CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect should be used.

DQC.US.0051.msg: ${childElement.name} should not be included in the calculation of ${element.name} in the group ${networkRole}.
content: ${element.name} is before the deduction of tax. Excluding the tax expense from the amount is inconsistent with the meaning of the element because this element represents a before tax item and should not be used to represent an after tax item.
If ${element.name} represents the amount after tax then use NetIncomeLoss instead.

DQC.US.0052.msg: The element ${fact1.label} with a value of ${fact1.value} has been used with the axis ${axis.label} and the member ${member.label}.
content: The ${member.label} element is not intended to be used in the instance document, instead the specific country from the SEC's Country Taxonomy is intended to tag the information.

fact.msg: The extension member, ${member.label} is used on the axis ${axis.label} with the element ${fact1.label} with a value of ${fact1.value}. ${member.label} should not be used with the ${axis.label}

nofact.msg: The member, ${member.label}, is used on the axis, ${axis.label} in the disclosure group ${group}. There are no facts associated with this member and axis. The ${member.label} member should not be used with the ${axis.label}.

DQC.US.0054.msg: The definition linkbase in the extension taxonomy defines the axis ${axis.label} as an axis of the table ${table.label}. This axis cannot be used on this table as this axis is expressly prohibited from being used on this table by the 2017 FASB taxonomy and retirement benefits implementation guide.
DQC.US.0054.hint: Consider using the axis Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis] instead.

DQC.US.0055.msg: Non of ${members.label} has been used on the ${axis.label} in the presentation linkbase ${networkRole}. The FASB requires that at least one of these members is present on the ${axis.label}.
DQC.US.0055.hint: Please review the axis and add one of these members or assess the need to use the ${axis.label}.

DQC.US.0057.msg: One of the following elements ${elementNames.name} should appear as the opening and closing balance in the cash flow statement using the group ${networkRole}.
content: Instead the following balance items have been used in this statement ${balanceElements.name}.
Depending if ASU-2016-18 has been adopted at least one of the opening and closing balance items listed must be used in the cash flow statement.

DQC.US.0060.msg: The element ${fact1.name} has been reported with a value of ${fact1.value}. However no value has been reported for either the element(s) ${DependentElements}.
content: It is expected that if the element ${fact1.name} is reported then values would be reported for these corresponding elements.
If the value of ${fact1.value} represents the value of ${GeneralElement.name} then this more general element should be used as it is a required disclosure.

DQC.US.0061.msg: The company's calculation relationship includes ${ParentElement} and ${ChildElement} in the calculation of ${changeInCashElement}.
content: But ${ChildElement} is not a direct child of ${ParentElement}. ${ParentElement} is intended to represent the total of cash provided by or used in continuing and discontinued operations.

Cash flows from both discontinued operations and continuing activities cannot add into the total of ${changeInCashElement}, as this implies that discontinued operations is being double counted, once in continuing activities and once as discontinued operations.

DQC.US.0062.msg: The filing includes a cash flow statement but does not report a value for the change in cash using any of the following elements:
content: 1. CashPeriodIncreaseDecrease
2. CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecrease
3. CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect
4. CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffect (As an extension element)
5. CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect (As an extension element)
6. NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations (As long as the element NetCashProvidedByUsedInDiscontinuedOperations is also included the reconciliation between opening and closing cash)
If you have disclosed a change in cash for the period, one of the above elements should be used. Please update your filing if one of the following has occurred:
1. The change in cash has not been represented with a value, in this case the element should be tagged with a value of zero.

2. The change in cash flow is dimensionally qualified with an inappropriate dimension. The instance should have a value reported with no dimensions. The rule will identify where the successor member has been used or an extension member. The value for change in cash should not have a dimension.
3. The change in cash has been represented with an extension element. There is no reason the change in cash needs to be identified using an extension member.

DQC.US.0065.msg: The Supplemental cash flow section has reported a value of ${fact1.value} for the element InterestPaid but the element InterestPaidNet is not included in the supplemental cash flow section. Interest Paid Net of the capitalized component must be reported in this section.
DQC.US.0065.hint: The element InterestPaid includes capitalized interest. If this element has no capitalized interest component then use the element InterestPaidNet instead.
